column2: CSX Corp. engages in the provision of rail-based freight transportation services. The company is headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida and currently employs 22,475 full-time employees. The firm provides rail-based freight transportation services, including traditional rail service and transport of intermodal containers and trailers, as well as other transportation services, such as rail-to-truck transfers and bulk commodity operations. The firm categorizes its products into three primary lines of business: merchandise, intermodal and coal. The firm's intermodal business links customers to railroads through trucks and terminals. The firm's merchandise business consists of shipments in markets, such as agricultural and food products, fertilizers, chemicals, automotive, metals and equipment, minerals and forest products. The firm's coal business transports domestic coal, coke and iron ore to electricity-generating power plants, steel manufacturers and industrial plants, as well as export coal to deep-water port facilities.
